name: xcode-comments
description: Xcode-style rendering for comments and doc comments

commands.title: Xcode Comments: Convert // to /// in the current file
Xcode Comments: Wrap comments to line length in the current file
Xcode Comments: Title Case // MARK: lines in the current file
Xcode Comments: Title Case // MARK: lines in the entire workspace

xcodeComments.enabled.description: Enable Xcode-style rendering for comments and doc comments.

xcodeComments.fontFamily.description: Font family for doc comment text. Use a proportional/sans-serif font for the Xcode look.

xcodeComments.fontSize.description: Optional font size override for doc comment text (e.g. "0.95em", "13px"). Leave empty to inherit the editor font size.

xcodeComments.monospaceFontSize.description: Optional font size override for monospace segments inside /// doc comments (inline code, parameter names, structural indent, markdown markers). Accepts any CSS size value (e.g. "0.95em", "13px"). Leave empty to inherit the editor font size.

xcodeComments.codeColor.description: Color for inline code (backtick-wrapped text and parameter names). Accepts any CSS color value. Leave empty to inherit the doc comment color.

xcodeComments.colorInlineCodeInRegularCo.description: When enabled, apply xcodeComments.codeColor to backtick-wrapped inline code within standard // comments (excluding // MARK: lines). This does not change fonts in standard comments.

xcodeComments.keywordColor.description: Color for doc keywords (Parameters, Returns, Throws, etc.). Accepts any CSS color value. Leave empty to inherit the doc comment color.

xcodeComments.boldMarkLines.description: Bold the contents of // MARK: comment lines, similar to Xcode.

xcodeComments.markSeparatorLines.description: Draw a subtle separator line above // MARK: - lines, similar to Xcode.

xcodeComments.maxCommentLineLength.description: Maximum line length for the Wrap Comments command. Lines will be wrapped to fit within this length (including indentation and // or /// prefix).

xcodeComments.wrapCountFromCommentStart.description: When wrapping comments, measure max line length starting at the // or /// prefix rather than column 0. This makes wrapping consistent regardless of indentation.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
